mikej wrote:
> Hello Michael and others,
> 
> I gathered the .project and .classpath files from the link below and dropped
> these in the top level directory of the heritrix-1.12.1 folder of the
> unzipped source. I used the Import feature in Eclipse. Initially the project
> name had a red X on it, which I discovered was the result of certain library
> includes not pointing the same versions included in the
> heritrix-1.12.1source downloaded. By right clicking on the project -->
> properties -->
> hightlight 'Java Build Path' --> I clicked on each one with a library jar
> with a yellow ! and Edited the location by browsing to the proper one
> dowloaded. This corrected the classpath issue.
> 
> My problem is now the project folder listed in the Project Explorer window
> now has a yellow exclamation. Expanding the main project folder I can see
> that the 'src/java' folder also has the yellow exclamation. In drilling down
> further most of the java c;ass files also have this as well. In looking at
> the source for each class I highlight the small yellow bands which note an
> error of some type and I get the following:
> ex. "Iterator is a raw type. References to generic type Iterator <E> should
> be parameterized"
> ex. "ListType is a raw type. References to generic type ListType <T> should
> be parameterized"
> All the errors seem to be of the type listed in the two examples here.
> 
> Is there something I am doing wrong in importing? If you can point me to
> documentation anywhere on pulling in Heritrix source and getting setup to
> build/compile and test out changes it would be greatly appreciated.
> 
> Thanks,
> Mike
> 
> 
> On 8/6/07, Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>>   The eclipse dot files must not be bundled into the src tarball.
>> Download them individually here from the heritrix_1_12 src branch --
>>
>> https://archive-crawler.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/branches/heritrix_1_12/
>> -- and put them manually into your unbundled src (or checkout the branch).
>> St.Ack
>>
>> mjjjhjemj wrote:
>>> I have downloaded the latest Heritrix source from Sourceforge -
>>> 1.12.1. It mentions in the manual somewhere that the .project and
>>> .classpath files are included in the top directory.
>>>
>>> A full search in the directories and all that I find are:
>>> project.xml and project.properties
>>>
>>> I am new to Eclipse and a java IDE and hope to some guidance on how to
>>> get started with the latest source in Eclipse. I am interested in
>>> making some changes to MirrorWriter and compiling the build and
>>> running tests on the changes.
>>>
>>> Thanks for any help,
>>> Mike
>>>
>>>
>>  
>>
>
